alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:48PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact the Great Sand Dunes National Park and Preserve in southwestern Custer and southeastern Saguache Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 445 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Great Sand Dunes. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Alamosa, western Huerfano, southwestern Custer and southeastern Saguache Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
